pageContext.description: Dimensions: EL 125.8; EWe 62.7; EWbt 29.1; max T 9.5,Typology: no surviving bevels; angles partly still crisp - sl. tendency for ridge in one stretch prob. result of corr. pattern rather than fg.; face v. sl. dished - not nec. orig.,Condition: bl. e. and tips totally blunted - bright gold ethos recent; as also butt hammering - dull and bright gold, with marked assoc. lipping.
pageContext.surface: Face dark dull green smooth sur. (?Rubbed) with scattered pocks lighter green; sides and rev. face gold-brown with bright gold flecks - v. badly pock-scarred.
pageContext.collection: Lewed, East Sussex Schools Museum Service, A,source unknown
pageContext.remarks: Label/Markings: Round stuck on label: A,Archive: PIF,PRBAF: DF (C),Ext: CI,Rec. SN Oct 79,Source: MV
